ovdesc.p: This application is a replica of JOB.TIMES file, to hold the historical information recorded in JOB.TIMES.

desc.p: Current service name can be fetched from here.
Identifies the actual process name / routine name that executed this job. Usually it will be BATCH.JOB.CONTROL.
Indicates the processing (value -1) or elimination (value -2) of the incoming keys.
The time taken for the job to get completed (I.e., END.TIME - START.TIME)
The time job was started.
Indicates whether CACHE.OFF is set as null. Accepts 'Y' or 'N'. Y indicates that CACHE.OFF is set as null.

The type of selection requested within BBL. What the select routine had passed as to whether it is a full select or filtered select or command being passed. Valid values are ALL,CRITERIA,FILTER and PREDEFINED
Identifies the total number of records/contracts that was processed.
Number of lock collisions during the whole job. This information is already available and has to be just updated
Should be the total number of writes happening in the job. Currently this field is not being updated
Identifies the number of records processed per minute. (calculated as: keys processed / elapsed time * 60)
Would be updated as ‘N’ in case the job is set as .NTX in PGM.FILE. Otherwise this field will be updated as ‘Y’
Indicates the time taken to do the SELECT
Specifies the fastest single throughput.
The name of the job that was processed.
Indicates the time the SELECT part of the job started.
The Actual select statement used in the .SELECT routine
This field will hold the number of agents that were processing the particular batch job
The bank date on which the batch was run
If the setup has been done to process the records on bulk, this field will hold the number of records that were processed in bulk
The number of IDs that were completely processed by this batch job
The clock time when the job was complete
The key used to identify the different records maintained on this file. The format of the ID is PROCESS.NAME-JOB.NAME.
Indicates the average response time per transaction rounded to three decimal places.
Provides the first 35 characters of the CONTROL.LIST value.
